results.title: Effects of beta-adrenoreceptor antagonists on cerebral blood flow of cirrhotic patients with portal hypertension.
results.text_hl: The current study evaluated the effect of two beta adrenergic-blocking agents, @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@PRP@@@) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@ATN@@@), versus placebo on cerebral blood flow (CBF) of three homogeneous groups of @<m>DISEASE_Idiopathic_Noncirrhotic_Portal_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000094724 @@@cirrhotic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertension_Portal @DISEASE_MESH:D006975 @@@portal hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Testa R, Rodriguez G, Dagnino F, Grasso A, Gris A, Marenco S, Nobili F, Risso D, Rosadini G, Celle G. Effects of beta-adrenoreceptor antagonists on cerebral blood flow of cirrhotic patients with portal hypertension. J Clin Pharmacol. 1991 Feb;31(2):136-9. PMID: 1672698
citations.BibTeX: @article{1672698, title={Effects of beta-adrenoreceptor antagonists on cerebral blood flow of cirrhotic patients with portal hypertension.}, author={Testa R and Rodriguez G and Dagnino F and Grasso A and Gris A and Marenco S and Nobili F and Risso D and Rosadini G and Celle G}, journal={J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={31}, number={2}, pages={136-9}}

results.title: Beta-blockers in the secondary prevention of gastrointestinal haemorrhage in well-compensated cirrhotics. A multicentre randomised controlled study.
results.text_hl: To assess the efficacy of beta-blockers in the prevention of rebleeding in selected @<m>DISEASE_Idiopathic_Noncirrhotic_Portal_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000094724 @@@cirrhotics@@@ and to compare the tolerability, safety of, and @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ compliance with, a selective and a non-selective beta-blocker, 94 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were randomly assigned to @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (32), @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (32), or placebo (30).

citations.NLM: Tommasini M, de Franchis R, Sangiovanni A, Colombo M. Beta-blockers in the secondary prevention of gastrointestinal haemorrhage in well-compensated cirrhotics. A multicentre randomised controlled study. Drugs. 1989;37 Suppl 2():35-41; discussion 47. PMID: 2572412
citations.BibTeX: @article{2572412, title={Beta-blockers in the secondary prevention of gastrointestinal haemorrhage in well-compensated cirrhotics. A multicentre randomised controlled study.}, author={Tommasini M and de Franchis R and Sangiovanni A and Colombo M}, journal={Drugs}, volume={37 Suppl 2}, pages={35-41; discussion 47}}
